channel.title: Oracle on Thinkside
channel.description: Recent content in Oracle on Thinkside

item.title: installing cx_oracle under ubuntu 10.10
item.description: If you plan on writing any python applications/scripts for performing any basic SQL query’s against an oracle database you will need to have the cx_oracle library files installed to your machine (or server) here are some quick instructions on how to install them. Please be aware i have only tested these instructions under Ubuntu 10.10 (32bit) using the 11.2 oracle instant client, when I have time I will try and install this on one of the x86_64 machines i have access to.

item.title: Installing Oracle 10g client on Ubuntu 9.10 x64
item.description: Here is a very quick way to get the oracle client installed under Ubuntu, only down side i have found on this is that you have to install the build packages and X to the machine to get it to install which isn’t something I like doing on production machines i would rather have X and build tools else where and install just the needed packages but never mind.

item.title: Adding a new data file into an Oracle 10g instance
item.description: First thing we need to check where the data files are being stored to do this all you need to do is log in as sysdba and then run ‘select * from dba_data_files;’ e.g. SQL> connect / as sysdba Connected. SQL> select * from dba_data_files; Once you have the location the syntax for adding the file is SQL> connect / as sysdba Connected. SQL> alter tablespace data_large add datafile '/lh0-mmm-sync/oracle/oradata/data0/data_large02.

item.title: How to change a password in Oracle 10g
item.description: sqlplus /nolog SQL> connect / as sysdba SQL> ALTER USER Your_Login IDENTIFIED BY Your_Password;

item.title: How to unlock an account in Oracle 10g
item.description: sqlplus /nolog SQL> connect / as sysdba SQL> alter user account unlock;

item.title: How to find out if an account has been locked in Oracle 10g
item.description: sqlplus /nolog SQL> connect / as sysdba SQL> SELECT username, account_status, password FROM dba_users;

item.title: Listing all users in a Oracle 10g database
item.description: sqlplus /nolog SQL> connect / as sysdba SQL> select * from all_users;

item.title: Starting and stopping an oracle DB
item.description: STARTING DATABASE Start Listerner up lsnrctl start Connect to sqlplus as sysdba SQL> connect sys as sysdba run command ‘startup’ SQL> startup Exit from sqlplus SQL> exit STARTING Enterprise Manager Login as oracle user run following command emctl start dbconsole example -bash-3.00$ emctl start dbconsole Oracle Enterprise Manager 10g Database Control Release 10.2.0.2.0 Copyright © 1996, 2005 Oracle Corporation. All rights reserved. http://dbman.
